p: Chromatographic peak 12 (4.94 min) and 13 (5.01 min) show a precursor ion [M − H] − at m/ z 463.0884, with the following composition of C 21H 19O 12 (mass error 1.33 ppm) and an MS2 base peak at m/ z 300.0274, resulting from the neutral loss of a hexose linked to quercetin. Their identification as quercetin-3- O-galactoside (hyperoside) (peak 12) and quercetin-3- O-glucoside (peak 13) ( Figure S2f) was solved by comparing their MS2 fragmentation pattern and their retention time to a hyperoside commercial standard that allowed a reliable discrimination.
